derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English stēam 'vapour', stēman 'emit a scent, be exhaled', of Germanic origin; related to Dutch stoom 'steam'

encyclopedia.content: Steam是一个游戏整合下载平台，由反恐精英(CS)的开发公司Valve聘请的BT发明者Bram·Cohen亲自开发设计。原先只是作为CS1.6、半条命2等Valve旗下游戏更新内容用，但现在已经发展成为全球最大的综合性游戏下载平台，来自全球各地的玩家只需几秒钟时间，即可用Visa国际信用卡或支付宝等手段，购买游戏并以飞快速度下载。

entry.def: Steam is the hot mist that forms when water boils. Steam vehicles and machines are operated using steam as a means of power.

example.ex: In an electric power plant the heat converts water into high-pressure steam.
example.tran: 在发电厂里，热能将水转化成高压蒸汽。

entry.def: If something steams, it gives off steam.

example.ex: ...restaurants where coffee pots steamed on their burners.
example.tran: 咖啡壶在炉子上冒着热气的餐馆
一篮子热腾腾的面包卷

entry.def: If you steam food or if it steams, you cook it in steam rather than in water.

example.ex: Steam the carrots until they are just beginning to be tender...
example.tran: 将胡萝卜蒸至刚好变软。

example.ex: Leave the vegetables to steam over the rice for the 20 minutes cooking time.
example.tran: 让蔬菜在米饭上蒸 20 分钟。

entry.def: If something such as a plan or a project goes full steam ahead, it progresses quickly.

example.ex: The Government was determined to go full steam ahead with its privatisation programme...
example.tran: 政府下决心要全力实施私有化计划。

example.ex: Plans are rolling full steam ahead for the Jamaica Festival.
example.tran: 庆祝牙买加节的准备工作正开展得如火如荼。

entry.def: If you let off steam, you get rid of your energy, anger, or strong emotions with physical activity or by behaving in a noisy or violent way.

example.ex: Regular exercise helps to combat unwanted stress and is a good way of relaxing or letting off steam.
example.tran: 经常运动有助于摆脱多余的压力，也是放松或宣泄情感的好办法。

entry.tran: (信念、计划、项目等)变得越来越重要，开始发展壮大
entry.def: If a belief, a plan, or a project picks up steam, it starts to develop and become more important.

example.ex: Just as the presidential campaign was picking up steam, riots exploded in Los Angeles.
example.tran: 正当总统竞选活动的声势日益壮大时，洛杉矶爆发了暴乱。

entry.tran: 精疲力竭;丧失热情;泄气
entry.def: If you run out of steam, you stop doing something because you have no more energy or enthusiasm left.

example.ex: I decided to paint the bathroom ceiling but ran out of steam halfway through.
example.tran: 我决定粉刷一下浴室的天花板，但干了一半就精疲力竭了。

entry.def: If you do something under your own steam, you do it without any help from anyone else.

example.ex: Patients who are well enough to turn up under their own steam are well enough to wait to be seen by a doctor.
example.tran: 让那些身体状况不那么糟、还能自己来看病的病人花点时间候诊没什么问题。

sentences.sentence: "The ship steamed off into the Pacific"

means.word_mean: 6. cook something by letting steam pass over it;

auth_sentence.res_content_con: More and more machines were powered by steam engines.

Sentence.sentence: The high cost of steam and the lesser need for speed kept the majority of the world's ocean freight moving by sail until the early years of the 20th century.

sentences.en: The steam sang as it escaped from the pipe.
sentences.cn: 蒸汽从管子逸出时呜呜作响。

sentences.en: The hot tea steamed my glasses.
sentences.cn: 热茶使我的眼镜蒙上了一层水气。

sentences.en: She held the letter over the kettle to steam it open.
sentences.cn: 她把信放在水壶上, 用蒸汽开启信封。

sentences.en: The ship steamed into the harbour.
She is steaming fish for supper.

jushi.english: His breath turned to steam that winter morning.
jushi.chinese: 那个冬天的早晨,他呼出的气都化成了气雾。

jushi.english: Every modest flower needs pure air and will not grow in steam.
jushi.chinese: 每一朵素洁的花需要在洁净的空气中生长,在不流通的空气中是不能生长的。
